data.title: About — FUKT Magazine
data.text:
What is FUKT?

FUKT is wholly dedicated to contemporary drawing and illustration. As one of the world’s leading drawing magazines, FUKT introduces you to outstanding creatives from around the globe ranging from emerging talents to long-established artists. Featured with artists’ interviews, and essays, the award-winning magazine is notable for its unrestricted layout and covers.

How long has FUKT been around?

Established in Trondheim, Norway 1999 and now based in Berlin and Oslo.

Who is behind the publication?

Bjørn Hegardt is the editor and Ariane Spanier is doing the design. The editorial team is small, engaged, and changing for each issue.

How often is FUKT published?

Annually.

What does FUKT mean?

It translates as “moist” or “damp” in Scandinavian languages.

Can I get a subscription?

Yes! You can subscribe for 2 issues, and in this way make sure you will receive the upcoming one when it’s released.

Where can I buy FUKT?

You can buy the issues in our online store. We also sell the magazine in many bookstores and newsstands, please check out stockists to find out stores selling FUKT. Or ask your local art bookshop to order copies!

If you have a bookstore and would like to sell the magazine, please take contact our distributor, or directly with us.

I do great drawings. Can I contribute to FUKT?

Yes! Just send an e-mail to submissions@fukt.de with a link to a website or some samples of work (jpgs or pdf, not too big) and the subject line of

"portfolio Your Name".

We do our best to reply, but it’s not always possible – we have many projects besides the magazine. We do look at all the work though!

Usually, we have an open call for every issue, so please keep your eyes open for this on our website and social media channels, or sign up for our newsletter to get all the info!
